activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom (SC-G020)

chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:14 AM Defendant London L Goodwin appeared by video.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for London L Goodwin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests a further proceedings date.
Defendant to appear by Zoom for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:30 AM Defendant London L Goodwin appeared by video.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for London L Goodwin.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is having issues with electronic discovery and requests more time.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Letter to Court dated August 26, 2022 re: Defense requests that defendant be allowed to appear via zoom, filed by Atty. Menden

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 27, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:12 AM Defendant London L Goodwin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts receipt of information and waives reading. 
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Atty Menden requesting an adjournment of prelim. Sent to CC Rieck to review. Court's response: The matter was scheduled over a month ago but his letter stating he could not appear was filed only 24 hours prior to his hearing. He must appear in person.

Defendant requests zoom - no driver's license and car broke down. - Sent to his Public Def. Court's response 6/21: Absent the filing of a preliminary hearing waiver form and an approved Zoom appearance, Mr. Goodwin is expected to be here in person and on time. Failure to do so may result in the issuance of a capias and the revocation and forfeiture of any bond
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:31 AM Defendant London L Goodwin appeared by Zoom with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eryn Menden
Hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:16 AM Defendant London L Goodwin appeared by Zoom.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court calls the matter for the Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM.  Hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:05 AM Defendant London L Goodwin in court by zoom.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did not receive the job he had applied for.  Defendant to re-apply at Public Defender's Office for representation and is to call after Court today.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will allow defendant to appear by zoom for the next date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:28 PM Defendant London L Goodwin in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs the defendant this Court did not see the fax sent in regarding the request for a zoom appearance.  The defendant states the Public Defenders office informed him if he obtains his employment he will not qualify for their services and he will find out tomorrow if he received the job.  The Court will set this for a status of counsel date on Tuesday so the defendant may inform the Court if he obtained employment.  If the defendant does not get the job, he will need to re-apply for public defender representation and if he does get the job, he may petition the Court for Court appointed counsel.  The Court provides the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will allow the defendant to appear by zoom for the status date next week.  Hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:00 AM Defendant London L Goodwin not in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**MINUTES UPDATED 11:05 am.  Court was unaware of the letter filed in the case that the defendant was requesting to appear by phone and further that he would attempt to appear at 1:00 pm today.  The Court will not issue a warrant at this time and reinstate bail.  The Court sets this matter for 1:00 pm today.

Faxed bond to defendant today

Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
